SEARCH
Package src.HWSystem

Class HWSystem

java.lang.Object
src.HWSystem.HWSystem
public class HWSystem extends Object
Main system class that manages hardware devices and their communication protocols. This class provides functionality for: - Managing different types of devices (sensors, displays, wireless I/O, motor drivers) - Handling device connections and disconnections - Controlling device states (ON/OFF) - Reading sensor data - Displaying information - Managing wireless communication - Controlling motor speeds

    HWSystem(String filePath)
    Creates a new hardware system and sets it up based on a configuration file.

  • Constructor Details

    • HWSystem

      public HWSystem(String filePath)
      Creates a new hardware system and sets it up based on a configuration file. The system starts by reading the configuration file which tells it: - What communication ports are available and what protocols they use - How many devices of each type it can handle - The initial state of the system
      Parameters:
      filePath - Path to the configuration file that contains the system settings

  • Method Details

    • addDev

      public void addDev(String devName, int portID, int devID)
      Connects a new device to the system. - Make sure the port you want to use is available - Check if the device ID you want to use is free - Verify it hasn't reached its limit for that type of device - Create the right kind of device based on its name - Set up all the necessary connections and records
      Parameters:
      devName - What kind of device you're adding
      portID - Which port you want to connect it to
      devID - A unique number to identify this device

    • rmDev

      public void rmDev(int portID)
      Removes a device from the specified port in the system. - Verify the port ID is valid - Check if a device is present at the specified port - Ensure the device is in OFF state before removal - Remove the device from all tracking collections - Clear all mappings and references to the device - Free up the device ID for future use
      Parameters:
      portID - The port from which to remove the connected device

    • turnON

      public void turnON(int portID)
      Activates the device connected to the specified port. This method powers on the device, enabling its functionality based on its type.
      Parameters:
      portID - The port identifier where the device is connected

    • turnOFF

      public void turnOFF(int portID)
      Deactivates the device connected to the specified port. This method powers off the device, transitioning it to an inactive state. Devices should be deactivated before removal from the system.
      Parameters:
      portID - The port identifier where the device is connected

    • listPorts

      public void listPorts()
      Displays list of all ports in the system with their status. For each port - Port ID and protocol type - Connection status (occupied/empty) - Device information when connected (name, type, ID) - Current operational state of connected devices (ON/OFF)

    • listDevType

      public void listDevType(String devType)
      Lists all devices of the specified type currently connected to the system. For each device, this method displays: - Device name - Device ID - Port ID where it's connected - Communication protocol used
      Parameters:
      devType - The category of devices to list (Sensor, Display, WirelessIO, or MotorDriver)

    • readSensor

      public void readSensor(int devID)
      Retrieves and displays the current reading from a sensor device. This method requests data from a specified sensor and outputs the formatted measurement data. The sensor must be in an active state for this operation to succeed.
      Parameters:
      devID - The identifier of the sensor to read from

    • printDisplay

      public void printDisplay(int devID, String data)
      Displays text on the display This method sends a string to be shown on the display identified by devID. The display must be in active state (ON) for the operation to succeed.
      Parameters:
      devID - The identifier of the display device
      data - The text content to be displayed

    • readWireless

      public void readWireless(int devID)
      Receives data from a specified wireless device. This method activates the receiving function on the target wireless device. The device must be in an active state for this operation to succeed.
      Parameters:
      devID - The identifier of the wireless device to receive data from

    • writeWireless

      public void writeWireless(int devID, String data)
      This method sends the provided string through a wireless connection. The wireless device must be in an active state for this operation to succeed.
      Parameters:
      devID - The identifier of the wireless device to use for transmission
      data - The content to be transmitted

    • setMotorSpeed

      public void setMotorSpeed(int devID, int speed)
      Sets the speed of a motor connected to the specified motor driver. This method controls the motor speed by sending the specified value to the motor driver. The motor driver must be active (ON state) for this operation to succeed.
      Parameters:
      devID - The identifier of the motor driver to control
      speed - The target speed value for the motor

    • closeAllPorts

      public void closeAllPorts()
      Safely closes all communication ports in the system. This method ensures proper resource cleanup and should be called before system shutdown.
